sub_title: | Remote Sensing | Urban Planning | Machine Learning | NLP | Ex-Assistant Director, DDA | Ex-Space4Good | Geo-Informatics | Computer Vision | Dutch HSM Recipient | 4k+ Followers |
summary:
Experienced Professional holding Bachelors and Master’s degrees in Urban and Regional Planning, I've cultivated extensive experience in the Planning Profession with top-tier Dutch and Indian firms. My journey in the geospatial domain led me to develop EarthML, an advanced Python library dedicated to streamlining geospatial and remote sensing data analysis. Check it out here: https://pypi.org/project/earthml/. EarthML offers processes for geospatial data conversion into geohashes and pre-processing of SAR datasets from Sentinel-1, ALOSPALSAR, and TerraSAR-X. With an ambitious roadmap, we're gearing up to include a broader spectrum of remote sensing sensors such as LiDAR, Hyperspectral, and Multispectral Optical.

Beyond this initiative, my work experience has sharpened my proficiency in Spatial Data Analysis through scientific methods, GIS techniques, and Python programming. I possess a proven track record in deploying Machine Learning Algorithms for GIS-based Regression Models and utilizing Remote Sensing Techniques for "Land Cover Segmentation", "Above Ground Biomass Estimation", and "Deforestation Detection".

Eager to leverage my expertise in addressing real-world contemporary Geo-Spatial challenges, I'm always open to collaborative opportunities that drive innovation in the urban sector.

📧 akhil.chibber@gmail.com | ☎ +31-687751485

treasury_media.title: Akhil's Curriculum Vitae
treasury_media.description:
Hardworking and enthusiast holding a Bachelors and Master’s degree in Urban Planning with extensive
experience of working in the Planning Profession with reputed Indian firms and Government. I am keen
to pursue a career in Remote Sensing and Machine Learning by utilizing my skill-sets in Spatial Data
Analysis in solving real world contemporary Geo-Spatial issues, using Earth Observation.

school.name: Faculty of Geo-Information Science and Earth Observation (ITC) of the University of Twente

education.grade: 93/100 in Mathematics in Xth CBSE Board Examination

awards.title: NASA-SERVIR Science Coordination Office Internship
awards.description:
Selected among the only 3 Students within the entire Batch (2020-22) of ITC, Faculty of Geo-Information Science and Earth Observations do my Internship in Collaboration between NASA-SERVIR and University of Alabama, Huntsville USA. My Internship Topic is "Fusion of LiDAR and Synthetic Aperture Radar to Generate Forest Stand Height Estimates in the Amazon". The Objective of this Project is to Prepare a Model using Python Code so as to Generate the Forest Stand Height (FSH) of entire Amazon Rain Forest using free available Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) and Light Detection and Ranging (LiDAR) data which can then be used in the Allometric Equation (e.g. AGB = 0.0673 × (𝜌× D2 ×H) 0.976) which can thereby be used to calculate the amount of "Carbon Sequestered" in the Amazon Rain Forest. This tool can definitely be beneficial to tackle the issue of Climate Change.

Project Presentation:
https://bit.ly/3zfaUIr

projects.title: EarthML: Geospatial Data Analysis Made Easy
projects.description: EarthML is an advanced Python library engineered to streamline the analysis of geospatial and remote sensing data. Developed with a vision to encompass a wide array of functionalities, EarthML currently supports geospatial data conversion into geohashes, and pre-processing of Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) datasets from Sentinel-1, ALOSPALSAR, and TerraSAR-X. EarthML is committed to expanding its functionalities to include other remote sensing sensors such as LiDAR, Hyperspectral, and Multispectral Optical in the near future.

projects.description:

projects.description:

projects.description:

2.  Introduced a low-cost and high-efficiency method for Tree Height Collection in a Tropical Forest using UAV images. 

3. Applied the Principles of Object Based Image Analysis (OBIA) and its application for analysis of High resolution data to capture Tree Canopy Area. 

4. Segmented High Resolution data to create a Canopy Area Map (DSM - DTM) to be used for Carbon Modeling and Mapping.

projects.title: GIS based analysis for assessing the accessibility of Urban Green Spaces: A case study of Zone-F, New Delhi, Score: 9/10
projects.description:
ACCOMPLISHMENTS:

This study presents use of GIS based network analysis to assess the accessibility of Urban Green Spaces (UGS) at different hierarchical levels by applying different network distance to each hierarchy of UGS in a developing region i.e. New Delhi, the capital of India. This study may provide useful tools to identify the deficient areas for future development of UGS for balanced and sustainable planning. As a resident of New Delhi, I expect that the UGS would not be accessible to the residential areas based on standards especially at the higher hierarchical levels.

Finished Inception Report, Interim Report, Draft Final Report and Final Report in a short duration of 2 months along with responsibility for presentation and submission of reports as per the tender deadlines to CEO of Municipal Committee Samba for their satisfaction and getting the payment from the client.

profile_positions.description:
ACCOMPLISHMENTS:

1. Designed a Spatio-Temporal Asset Catalog (STAC), consisting of > 50 Python functions to create STAC Collection, Item, and Asset, used for cataloging and data management of different geospatial formats including .shp, .geojson, .las, .tiff, etc.

2. Developed an API using FastAPI in Python for the Spatio-Temporal Asset Catalog (STAC), to ensure its use across multiple services. This API service is now used for cataloging all the Geospatial data which enters the organization.

3. Leaded a Discrete Global Grid System (DGGS) grid-based analytics Project, involving creation and setting-up of multiple services as API including GeoServer (in Java), DGGS Services, ClickHouse OLAP, etc. used for global grid based analysis.
profile_positions.title: Remote Sensing Scientist

profile_positions.description:
EarthML is an advanced Python library engineered to streamline the analysis of geospatial and remote sensing data. Developed with a vision to cover a wide array of functionalities, EarthML currently supports geospatial data conversion into geohashes, and pre-processing of Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) datasets from Sentinel-1, ALOS PALSAR, and TerraSAR-X.

Features:
1. Geohash Calculation: Automatically computes the smallest geohash that represents the geographical bounds of the dataset.

2. SAR Data Pre-Processing: Offers functionalities for pre-processing steps on SAR datasets from Sentinel-1, ALOS PALSAR, and TerraSAR-X. This includes thermal noise removal, radiometric calibration, speckle filtering, and geometric correction.

3. Adaptive Speckle Filtering Technique: EarthML offers advanced algorithm Adaptive Speckle Filtering Technique that dynamically adjusts based on the local properties of the SAR image to reduce noise while ensuring that essential image details remain intact, enhancing the overall quality of SAR imagery.

4. Future-Ready: EarthML is actively improving with a roadmap for integration of other remote sensing sensors such as LiDAR 🌲, Hyperspectral 🌈, and Multispectral Optical 📸.

Collaborate with EarthML:
🛰️ For Remote Sensing Specialists : If you have an M.Sc. or higher qualification in Remote Sensing and recognize gaps in the geospatial market that no other python library address, I'd love to hear your insights. Please feel free to connect and drop me a direct message.

👩‍💻 For Contributors: Passionate about shaping the future of geospatial analysis with us? To maintain the quality and expertise of EarthML, we welcome contributors with an M.Sc. or higher qualification in Remote Sensing. Looking forward to innovative collaborations!

Link: https://pypi.org/project/earthml/

2. Evaluated the Deep Learning Architecture in GIS which was prepared for Data Fusion and using standalone Sentinel-1 (Radar) and Sentinel-2 (Optical) data for both Cloudy and Cloud Free weather condition.
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis Student

profile_positions.description:
Project Title: Above Ground Biomass (AGB) Estimation using Remote Sensing Techniques

ACCOMPLISHMENTS:

1. Prepared GIS based Regression Models using different Machine Learning Algorithms in Python including (i) Decision Tree, (ii) Random Forest, (iii) Support Vector Machine (SVM), (iv) K-Nearest Neighbor and (v) ADA Boosting methods. 

2. Estimated the Above Ground Biomass (AGB) of Trees using GIS specifically ArcMap in Tanzania in the Eastern parts of Africa using different Satellite Datasets including of Airborne LiDAR, GEDI Level-4A, Sentinel-1 (Radar) and Sentinel-2.

profile_positions.description:
